newsitem.title: UK: Sainsbury sees minimum wage impact if over 4 stg.
newsitem.headline: Sainsbury sees minimum wage impact if over 4 stg.

text.p: A minimum wage set by the British government would not make a difference to supermarket chain J. Sainsbury Plc unless it was over four stg per hour, chief executive Dino Adriano told Reuters.
"It would have to be over four pounds for any impact," he said.
Adriano said that most of the company's staff were already paid 3.50 stg per hour, depending on calculations of benefits such as discounts.
The Labour government, which swept to power in a landslide victory on May 1, has committed itself to introducing a minimum wage and signing up up to the European Union Social Chapter.

Confederation of British Industry (CBI) chief Adair Turner said on Tuesday that industry could accept a minimum wage of up to 3.50 stg per hour, but added that beyond that "it will have a negative impact."
